page.title: 19Brook Hall Farm
page.content: In 1936 a farmer emigrated from Scot- land by special train - labourers, horses, carts and cattle moved to Borley. Now{the Brands}farm 1800 acres from half a dozen little old farms, with just 14 men on 40hr/wk, 2 big combines, and 14 tractors. {Acreage -}sugar beet 150,spring barley 100, winter barley 300, winter wheat 950, without rotation. The British Friesian{dairy herd}has 140 cows in milk and 140 younger ones. They have won many prizes at top agri- cultural shows -{Foxearth Paddy}etc. but have not entered lately. They make no hay; but, of 300 acres under grass, 100 is for silage and 200 acres are for summer grazing. The cattle live indoors all winter in a new complex. In our playground stands an old{cart from the farm, presented by Mr. Brand. We have great games on it!
